node.title: 'To save face': How China has recruited foreign-born athletes to boost its Olympic campaign
node.alt: Skier waves to the crowd during the Olympic Games
node.description: China has entered a record number of athletes in this year's Beijing Winter Olympics, but many of the competitors representing Team China were born and trained in foreign countries, like the US.
node.content:
["A spectacular finish for American-born Eileen Gu, a freestyle skier, secured the 18-year-old her first gold medal for China this week at the Beijing Winter Olympics.", "After her victory, China's General Administration of Sport sent her a congratulatory letter encouraging her to \"strive for greater glory for the Party and the people\" and continue to help realise \"the dream of a powerful sports nation\".", "But Gu's victory cast the spotlight on a more uncomfortable topic related to her participation for China: her citizenship status.", "Like many of the athletes representing Team China, Gu was born and trained in a foreign country but competes for China.", "However, it's unclear whether she or any of the others have given up their foreign passports\u00a0to comply with China's rules banning dual citizenship.", "Or whether China has bent the rules to get more elite athletes on board.", "Jeanne Huang, an international law expert at the University of Sydney, said it was \"impossible\" for the International Olympic Committee\u00a0(IOC) and China to provide exemptions to the citizenship requirement.", "\"The Olympic Charter Rule 41 is very clear, which requires the athletes to have the citizenship for representing a country,\" Dr Huang said.", "\"China's law on citizenship, it's very strict. It clearly says it does not recognise dual citizenship.", "\"Only those who made great contributions to China and have strong connections with the country can be granted with the citizenship.\"", "Gu herself has remained ambiguous on the topic.\u00a0", "The lack of clarity on her\u00a0citizenship comes at a tense time in geopolitical relations, and\u00a0when Beijing is trying to demonstrate dominance on the world stage.", "China has entered a record number of athletes \u2014176 \u2014\u00a0in this year's Games.", "\"China is not a powerful nation in winter sports,\" said Sow Keat Tok, a China researcher at the University of Melbourne.", "
China 'playing a political game'
", "", "
China's Zhu Yi falls in a\u00a0team figure skating event at the Beijing Winter Olympics.(AP: David J\u00a0Phillip)
", "Other athletes competing for China that have attracted scrutiny include the American-born figure skater Zhu Yi, who was criticised by Chinese netizens after she fell during her event and finished last.\u00a0", "The men's ice hockey team has also been in the spotlight, after China put together a team including 11\u00a0Canadians,\u00a0three Americans, and one\u00a0Russian player.", "Team China's American-born ice hockey goalie Jeremy Smith recently told ESPN\u00a0he did not renounce\u00a0his US citizenship and China\u00a0did not ask him to.", "China automatically qualified for the ice hockey competition because it is hosting the games and\u00a0the\u00a0team lost to the US in their\u00a0Olympic debut last week.\u00a0", "", "
Only nine players in China's ice hockey team originate from China.(Reuters: Brian Snyder)
", "It's unclear how many athletes in Team China fall under this citizenship cloud.\u00a0", "The ABC contacted the IOC for clarification but\u00a0the response did not address the specific questions, instead saying that athletes'\u00a0citizenship was governed by the Olympic Charter.", "That\u00a0charter\u00a0states competitors can hold more than one citizenship, but can only represent one country at an Olympic Games.", "The Chinese Olympic Committee has also been approached for comment.", "Heidi Grappendorf,\u00a0an expert in sports management at Western Carolina University, said China was \"playing a bit of a political game\" with the Olympic rules and its own laws that don't allow dual citizenship.", "\"I would posture with the already tumultuous fact that the games are being held in a country with alleged massive civil rights violations, as well as the political nature and icy relations of China and the US, that the IOC may be actively choosing to remain silent to avoid fuelling any further controversy.\"", "
Recruiting foreign-born athletes a 'common phenomenon'
", "", "
Li Shixin competed for Australia in the Tokyo Olympics.(AAP: Dan Himbrechts)
", "China is far from the only country to enlist so-called \"ringers\".", "US-born NBA player\u00a0Matisse Thybulle only spent seven years in Australia as a child but because he maintained dual Australia-US citizenship he was able to play with the Australian basketball team at last year's Tokyo Olympic Games.\u00a0", "Naturalising foreign-born athletes is another tactic\u00a0used by countries to boost competitiveness, said Dr Tok.", "\"Since the 1990s, many Chinese athletes have been naturalised in other countries,\" he said.", "Naturalised means to make a person a legal citizen of a country they were not born in.", "To attract foreign sports talent,\u00a0Australia currently offers a distinguished talent visa\u00a0under the Global Talent Visa Program, a permanent residency for those who \"have an internationally recognised record of exceptional and outstanding achievement\"\u00a0in a sport.", "Li Shixin, a Chinese-born Australian Olympic diver, was a star of China's diving team before moving to Australia\u00a0in 2017.", "", "
Beijing Winter Olympic\u00a0mascots Shuey Rhon Rhon and\u00a0Bing Dwen Dwen.(Reuters: Fabrizio Bensch)
", "He competed in the Tokyo Olympics and told the ABC he \"felt the pressure of winning\" for Australia.", "Li\u00a0believes the geopolitical tensions between China and the US have intensified the focus on Team China's American-born athletes, but competitors \"need to bear such pressure\".", "\"Winning the game is not the most important thing. Rather, presenting the best of yourself is,\" he added.", "Beijing explicitly outlined its strategy to recruit naturalised athletes\u00a0for women's figure skating and ice dance for the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics in its \"National Development Plan for Ice and Snow Sports (2016-2025)\".", "Zhu Yi was the\u00a0first athlete recruited under the Morning Road program."]
